fields.info: Read returns 0. Writes have no effect.
This bit resets the SCI module.

values.desc: SCI module is in reset.
SCI module is out of reset.
Disable transfers from SCITD to SCITXSHF.
Enable SCI to transfer data from SCITD to SCITXSHF.

fields.info: Receive enable. RXENA allows or prevents the transfer of data from SCIRXSHF to SCIRD.

values.desc: The receiver will transfer data from the shift buffer to the receive buffer.

fields.info: Loopback bit. The self-checking option for the SCI can be selected with this bit.

values.desc: Loop back mode is disabled.
Loop back mode is enabled.

fields.info: If the POWERDOWN bit is set while the receiver is actively receiving data and the wake-up

values.desc: Normal operation.
Low-power mode is enabled.

fields.info: SCI sleep. In a multiprocessor configuration, this bit controls the receive sleep function.

values.desc: Sleep mode is disabled.
Sleep mode is enabled.

fields.info: Software reset (active low). This bit is effective in LIN and SCI modes.

values.desc: The SCI is in its reset state; no data will be transmitted or received.
The SCI is in its ready state; transmission and reception can be done.
The external SCICLK is the clock source.

fields.info: SCI number of stop bits per frame.

values.desc: One stop bit is used.
Two stop bits are used.

fields.info: SCI parity odd/even selection. If the PARITY ENA bit is set, PARITY designates odd or even parity.

values.desc: Odd parity is used.
Even parity is used.

fields.info: Parity enable. This bit enables or disables the parity function.

values.desc: Parity is disabled; no parity bit is generated during transmission or is expected during reception.
Parity is enabled. A parity bit is generated during transmission and is expected during reception.
Synchronous timing is used.
Asynchronous timing is used.
Idle-line mode is used.
Address-bit mode is used.

fields.info: Send checksum byte. This bit is effective in LIN mode only.
Generate wakeup signal. This bit is effective in LIN mode only.
Power down. This bit is effective in LIN or SCI mode.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read or write: The interrupt is enabled.
Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read or write: The interrupt is enabled.
Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read or write: The interrupt is enabled.
Read: The DMA request is disabled for address frames (the receive interrupt request is enabled
Read and write: The DMA request is enabled for address and data frames
Read: The DMA request is disabled.
Read and write: The DMA request is enabled for address and data frames

fields.info: Set transmit DMA. To enable DMA requests for the transmitter, this bit must be set.

values.desc: Read: Transmit DMA request is disabled.
Read and write: Transmit DMA request is enabled.
Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read or write: The interrupt is enabled.
Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read or write: The interrupt is enabled.
Read: The interrupt is disabled.

fields.info: Clear framing-error interrupt. This bit disables the framing-error interrupt when set.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Clear overrun-error interrupt. This bit disables the SCI overrun error interrupt when set.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read: The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Clear parity interrupt. This bit disables the parity error interrupt when set.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read: The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Clear receive DMA all. This bit clears the receive DMA request for address frames when set.

values.desc: Read: Receive DMA request for address frames is disabled; Instead, RX interrupt requests are
Read: The receive DMA request for address and data frames is enabled.

fields.info: Clear receive DMA request. This bit disables the receive DMA request when set.

values.desc: Read: The DMA request is disabled.
Read: The receive DMA request is enabled.
Read: Transmit DMA request is disabled.
Read: The transmit DMA request is enabled.

fields.info: Clear receiver interrupt. This bit disables the receiver interrupt when set.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read: The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Clear transmitter interrupt. This bit disables the transmitter interrupt when set.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read: The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Clear wakeup interrupt. This bit disables the wakeup interrupt when set.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read: The interrupt is enabled.

fields.info: Clear breakdetect interrupt. This bit disables the break-detect interrupt when set.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt is disabled.
Read: The interrupt is enabled.

values.desc: Read: The interrupt level is mapped to the INT0 line.
Read: The interrupt level is mapped to the INT1 line.

fields.info: Framing error flag. This bit is effective in LIN or SCI-compatible mode.

values.desc: Read: No framing error has been detected since the last clear.
Read: A framing error has been detected since the last clear.
Read: No overrun error has been detected since the last clear.
Read: An overrun error has been detected since the last clear.

fields.info: Parity error flag. This bit is set when a parity error is detected in the received data.

values.desc: Read: No parity error has been detected since the last clear.
Read: A parity error has been detected since the last clear.
The data in SCIRD is not an address.
The data in SCIRD is an address.
Transmitter buffer or shift register (or both) are loaded with data.
Transmitter buffer and shift registers are both empty.
Frame to be transmitted will be data (address bit = 0).
Frame to be transmitted will be an address (address bit = 1).
Read: No new data is in SCIRD.
Read: New data is ready to be read from SCIRD.
SCITD is full.
SCITD is ready to receive the next character.

fields.info: Bus busy flag. TThis bit indicates whether the receiver is in the process of receiving a frame.

values.desc: The receiver is not currently receiving a frame.
The receiver is currently receiving a frame.
The idle period has been detected; the SCI is ready to receive.
The idle period has not been detected; the SCI will not receive any data.
Read: The module will not wake up from power-down mode.
Read: Wake up from power-down mode.

fields.info: SCI break-detect flag. This bit is set when the SCI detects a break condition on the LINRX pin.

values.desc: Read: No break condition has been detected since the last clear.
Read: A break condition has been detected.

fields.info: Interrupt vector offset for INT0. This register indicates the offset for interrupt line INT0.
Interrupt vector offset for INT1. This register indicates the offset for interrupt line INT1.
Character length control bits. These bits set the SCI character length from 1 to 8 bits.

values.desc: The character is 1 bit long.
The character is 2 bits long.
The character is 3 bits long.
The character is 4 bits long.
The character is 5 bits long.
The character is 6 bits long.
The character is 7 bits long.
The character is 8 bits long.

fields.info: Emulator data. Reading SCIED[7:0] does not clear the RXRDY flag, unlike reading SCIRD.
Transmit data. Data to be transmitted is written to the SCITD register.
Transfer function. This bit defines the function of pin SCITX.

values.desc: SCITX is a general-purpose digital I/O pin.
SCITX is the SCI transmit pin.

fields.info: Receive function.This bit defines the function of pin SCIRX.

values.desc: SCIRX is a general-purpose digital I/O pin.
SCIRX is the SCI receive pin.
SCITX is a general-purpose input pin.
SCITX is a general-purpose output pin.
SCIRX is a general-purpose input pin.
SCIRX is a general-purpose output pin.

fields.info: Transmit pin in. This bit contains the current value on the SCITX pin.

values.desc: The SCITX pin is at logic low (0).
The SCITX pin is at logic high (1).

fields.info: Receive pin in. This bit contains the current value on the SCIRX pin.

values.desc: The SCIRX pin is at logic low (0).
The SCIRX pin is at logic high (1).
The output on the SCITX is at logic low (0).
The output on the SCITX pin is at logic high (1).
The output on the SCIRX pin is at logic low (0).
The output on the SCIRX pin is at logic high (1).
Read: The output on SCITX is at logic low (0).
Read and write: The output on SCITX is at logic high (1).
Read: The output on SCIRX is at logic low (0).
Read and write: The output on SCIRX is at logic high (1).
Read: The output on SCITX is at logic low (0).
Read: The output on SCITX is at logic high (1).
Read: The output on SCIRX is at logic low (0).
Read: The output on SCIRX is at logic high (1).
Open drain functionality is disabled; the output voltage is VOL or lower if TXOUT = 0 and VOH or
Open drain functionality is enabled; the output voltage is VOL or lower if TXOUT = 0 and high
Open drain functionality is disabled; the output voltage is VOL or lower if RXOUT = 0 and VOH or
Open drain functionality is enabled; the output voltage is VOL or lower if RXOUT = 0 and high

fields.info: Transmit pin pull control disable. This bit disables pull control capability on the input pin SCITX.

values.desc: The pull control on the SCITX pin is enabled.
The pull control on the SCITX pin is disabled.

fields.info: Receive pin pull control disable. This bit disables pull control capability on the input pin SCIRX.

values.desc: Pull control on the SCIRX pin is enabled.
Pull control on the SCIRX pin is disabled.

fields.info: TX pin pull select. This bit selects pull type in the input pin SCITX.

values.desc: The SCITX pin is a pull down.
The SCITX pin is a pull up.

fields.info: RX pin pull select. This bit selects pull type in the input pin SCIRX.

values.desc: The SCIRX pin is a pull down.
The SCIRX pin is a pull up.

fields.info: Frame error enable. This bit is used to create a frame error.

values.desc: No error is created.
The stop bit received is ANDed with 0 and passed to the stop bit check circuitry.

fields.info: Parity error enable. This bit is used to create a parity error.

values.desc: No parity error occurs.
The parity bit received is toggled so that a parity error occurs.

fields.info: Break detect error enable. This bit is used to create a BRKDT error.

values.desc: No error is created.
The stop bit of the frame is ANDed with 0 and passed to the RSM so that a frame error
No mask is used.
Invert the TX Pin value at 7th.SCLK.
Invert the TX Pin value at 8th.SCLK.
Invert the TX Pin value at 9th.SCLK.
No delay occurs.
The value is delayed by 1 SCLK.
The value is delayed by 2 SCLK.
The value is delayed by 3 SCLK.
The value is delayed by 4 SCLK.
The value is delayed by 5 SCLK.
The value is delayed by 6 SCLK.
No delay occurs.

fields.info: IODFT enable key. Write access permitted in Privilege mode only.

values.desc: IODFT is enabled.
IODFT is disabled.

fields.info: Module loopback enable. Write access permitted in Privilege mode only.

values.desc: Digital loopback is enabled.
Analog loopback is enabled in module I/O DFT mode when IODFTENA = 1010.

fields.info: Module analog loopback through receive pin enable.

values.desc: Analog loopback through the transmit pin is enabled.
Analog loopback through the receive pin is enabled.
